Anyway, I just dont know if this is normal healing or hematoma/seroma something of that sort...but the whole outside portion is very hard like a HUGE lump.....not worried about bc... just want it to get better..even if its a hematoma, they will probably just say to wait and it will go away, so I'm tempted to skip the f/u appointment ( I know thats bad) ...well I hope the time goes by quickly for you and your surgery will be overwith soon... hang in there...I know waiting is the pits... Posts.Title: Anxiety Setting In Waiting For Surgery tygress leaf

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2008 11:20AM anniee wrote: Ho Goldie, I am so sorry to hear of your troubles...seems many women have a difficult time getting their Dr.s to take their concerns seriously...and thats so wrong....I  am having trouble myself right now....I have had discharge for many years, have had it evaluated with no diagnosis. I also have a lump which I have been attempting to deal with...can I ask you if your discharge was milky to begin with, and also, was the discharge  spontaneous? Meaning it occured on its own without being expressed. They always tell you to check for discharge in an exam...but then when it is only there when expressed,,,its not a concern....I have rec'd the same talk you did about my discharge. I also have had two mammos and ultrasound....my dr. refused to authorize an MRI, saying it is not warranted... Hopefully they have caught this very early, (even with the delay in diagnosis... it could have been EARLIER, thats for sure) but I hope that you will get answers right away and get underway for surgery asap so that they can get answers on the lymph nodes...you will be here for your kids...you're gonna fight this with everything you've got... the treatments they have these days are so much better than in the past... there are so many women on this site who have felt the same as you, and are in remission...in many cases.. a lumpectomy and radiation is all that is needed...(that was the case for my sister) Well, I just wanted to tell you that you have found the right place for information and support...you will be amazed by the dedication and caring from the women here...you have just found yourself a few hundred new sisters who will help carry you through the journey you have just begun...hang in there...they say once you have a plan in place, you will feel much better...you will be in my prayers...Anniee

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2008 01:37PM anniee wrote: Thats a mom for ya', we do watch close....sending love and support to you and your family...also, about that boil...you may want to ask about MRSA if you get the boil checked out....I've heard its going around, its a bacterial infection which is resistent to antibiotics and can also be dangerous...I dont want to scare you, but sometimes a very agressive form of cancer called inflammatory breast cancer can present this way as well....its very rare, so the chances that it is a boil are far more likely...but I suggest you get it checked out ASAP. I'm sorry you are going through so much with your "mawmaw" and your mom, and you too....do you know what type of cancer your mom has? Anyway...hope you can get this checked out in a speedy manner....you may have to be persistent because of your age so be prepared for that.....Hugs,.......anniee

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2008 04:40PM anniee wrote: Hi Little G.... I know you are concerned with the lung nodule and why you have chest pain...but just on a longshot....thought I'd mention GERD? Also, chest pain can be from muscles which were strained during heavy coughing....also, I'm sure your aware Bronchitis can progress to pneumonia...so be very careful. Does the pain hurt more when you breath deep? Does your cough produce phlegm? Could any meds you are taking be causing GERD? When was the lung nodule last checked and stable? Just thought I'd help think of some of the B9 reasons for your symptoms...since you are concerned about unnecessary costs adding up...but I sure understand why you would want  definite answers. I would too...hang in there..were all hoping for the best and hopefully this can be figured out without too much cost to you. ((Hugs))....Anniee
Posts.Title: Bronchitis? Need Advice. Little-G tos

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2008 07:13PM anniee wrote: Hi Sugarpea...Unfortunately there is no way to know what is going on without a much more thorough investigation than that which your Dr. has offered you. (ZIP!)  A lump in the armpit can have many causes, b9 or otherwise. Even if someone here had had a lump in the same area that turned out to be cancer, it would not decrease or increase your chance that YOUR lump would be cancer. We, myself included, tend to try to figure out what''s going on based on anothers experience, and in this case, I've learned that just cant be done. The exact same lump on one women may be b9, while a less suspicious lump will be found to be cancerous...there is not much rhyme or reason. You need at the least a mammo and ultrasound. 80% of lumps are found to be b9, as mine was.  The waiting and testing is difficult to get through, but in the end I am happy to have the piece of mind that my lump was b9. In order to get this definite diagnosis, I had mammo, ultrasound, galactogram, and finally lumpectomy. It was all worth it.  Was the dr. you are referring to a gyn? If so, he should have no problem with a breast exam...and if not...see a gyn. If he was your gyn you should call back and ask for an ultrasound or mammo (or both). Sometimes you just have to come right out and say, "I am not comfortable with that diagnosis" (if you can call what he told you a "diagnosis")   Be ready to join the waiting game to find out what's going on, but it is well worth it! You have found the right place for information and support, as you will soon find out! We'll all be counting on b9 results for you...please let us know how you come along with the Dr. Hope he's willing to listen a little better this time around. Wishing you all the best,....anniee

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2008 01:51PM anniee wrote: Hi Tygress...I just wanted you to know that I have been reading your posts, and following, I think I may have responded somewhere else, but I'm not sure....I dont know very much about breast cancer, but I can definitely relate to your feelings of wanting to know what the heck is going on..it feels like maybe if I can get enough answers, I'll be able to figure out what the he** is going on!! This is how I feel anyhow. You may or may not be able to relate to that, considering it is completely irrrational....unfortunately, we have to do the awful waiting and wondering, there's not a way around it,  but the ladies here are very imformative and can help you to know which questions to ask, which tests are appropriate, etc.,they are incredibly supportive, and can help to ease some of our worries with their support and knowlege. By the way, if anyone was going to get ignored for something theysaid, it would have been me, and that certainly has not been the case....the women here have embraced me even when I got down-right bi**chy. So dont worry, nothing you have said put anyone off. I'm sure of that. As far as my huband, he doesnt know what to think....he's supportive and kind..as I'd expect because he's the nicest person I've ever met..He did palpate the lump for me, even though he really didnt want too. I wanted him to feel it so he would know I wasnt crazy.... he not the type to placate me at all, so I knew if he said yes he feels its a hard lump, than it definitely is..( I know it is, but sometimes I question myself) .my older sister who said "oh yeah, I would be concerned about that too" is more the type to say yes, just to shut me up!  Anyway, about you. The 27th is this coming Wednesday so try to keep yourself distracted especially over the weekend. It is very good that you are seeing a breast specialist right off the bat...with your symptoms I'm sure your just worried sick and that is normal....nobody wants to be poo-pooed when they have any question what is going on with breast health. As I say, I am not knowledgable enough about BC, so I will stay away from any advice giving.... I will just hope and pray that you find some peace while you are doing this waiting game, and that answers come as quickly as possible. Hopefully they will have a very clear picture of what is going on with the mammo and ultrasound... We will all keep in touch, dont worry! ((HUGS)).....Annie

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2008 03:47AM anniee wrote: Hi Em, I just wanted to tell you that I am the queen of worry...I know that what you are saying is that no one can make you feel better until you have that ultrasound...I know exactly how you feel.. I recently had a lump and discharge which the Dr. defined as just lumpy breast tissue...and I insisted it was a lump...(so middle of the road could be called thickening.) It turned out to be a b9 lipoma. (fatty tumor) I know how hard it is to wait for testing...thats the worst part...I was a wreck...try to keep busy..treat yourself to your favorite things. All the women here are very knowledgeable and supportive  and will help you through this...as Nash says, we dont want to downplay your fears...were just here to hold your hand and lift you up when you need it. How far along are you? You must be so excited...pregnancy is so fun, hopefully soon you will be back to counting the weeks and picking out carseats! I will keep you in my prayers that the answers will be very soon and "boringly b9" like mine was. ((Hugs))....Anniee p.s. There are two Annie's here..thats why I use the extra "E" for my last name...my name is really Annie...not to be confused with the other Annie...sometimes known as "Camel Breath Annie!"

We're all here to answer any questions you may have, and help lift you, or your mom up when you need it....I am not very knowlegeable myself, but there are many VERY knowlegeable and helpful veterans here who will be able to sort out your concerns.... Posts.Title: Scared Jessabell54 anniee

Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2008 01:06PM anniee wrote: Some women will notice a dent or dimple, a pitted appearance, breast discharge...swelling or change in contour of the breast...some have pain...a rash that appears like insect bites or an orange peel lookin rash...some cancers do not present as a lump....some have lumps which you just cannot feel but are still present...these symptoms could also indicate an infection..if you are concerned, you should see your Dr. right away...in any case, early diagnosis is essential....

Posts.Title: Oncotype results in artsee artsee

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2008 06:24PM anniee wrote: Wow! I havent met too many people who have as many sisters as me! (I am 44, by the way) Any brothers? None in my family....I am a twin and my older sisters are twins too...one of the older twins is the one who has BC... If it is one centimeter, and she showed you where it is, and now you feel it...dont second guess yourself... I have recently had a lumpectomy which was found to be b9....I was fairly certain it would be b9, but I just wanted it out....mine was not seen on U/S or mammo....just felt...and my doc said it was probably just "lumpy breast tissue"...it was a long story...first she called it a cyst, then changed to "lumpy breast tissue"...it was a lipoma which is a fatty tumor incapsolated in some way... I hope your Dr. will fill you in a little better on what she thinks of things...just so you know, one really good diagnostic imaging tool is MRI...as you probably know already its a very expensive test.....so sometimes its hard to get your Dr. to order it, but with your family history...I would be very careful....up to 15% of lumps are missed on mammo...it probably is nothing to worry about, but "probably" just doesnt cut it for most women...I'm sure you feel the same way...thats why you're here....you have found a great place to gain support and knowlege...the ladies here are awesome! I like to tell people who are new...you have just found yourself a few hundred new sisters....even for you and me thats alot! Hang in there ..... someone who knows more than me about all of this will hopefully come along soon!  ......Anniee

Posts.Title: hard lumps post lumpectomy anniee Kimber

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2008 05:33PM - edited Mar 7, 2008 05:34PM by anniee definitely.           If you do not feel comfortable AND with your family history... Also it has been said many times here that the only good lump is one in a jar. Many women have had clean mammos AND U/S and have later been diagnosed with BC....at the same time,  keep in mind 80% of lumps are b9....but with your family history, I would want better reassurance than what they have given you... push for ANYTHING that will give you piece of mind....I am so sorry to hear that you lost your mother and sister, that is devastating... Do you mean your other sister had DCIS? Do you feel the lump also, and how big is it? How old are you? How many sisters do you have? (I have 6, only one has had BC)  Sorry for inundatiing you with so many questions.....I think you should at least check with the Dr. who found the lump....I hope you get more answers soon....Anniee

Posts.Title: invisible lump and milk? anniee anniee

Posts.Content: anniee wrote: Hi everyone....I'm new here and have read all the posts re; lumps not being visualized sometimes...I have a small lump in my outer right breast (9:00) that has not been able to be imaged with mammo and us. I also produce milk from this breast, have had a ductography with no finding. My surgeon felt the lump as well. When she got the results of the ductography, she called and left a message to be seen again in 6 months, the milk is not a problem,(right side only) but didnt mention the lump at all. (I've had this milk at least 6 years. I called and told her I didnt feel comfortable with waiting that long, (this was December,) and she agreed to see me on Feb. 19.  Should I push for a biopsy? If so, what sort. The lump feels about the consistency of a stail gummy bear! LOL! It is about a centimeter long and thin. Am I making to much of this? By the way, I have not breast fed for 11 years. I am 44with surgical menopause at 38, with an older sister (46) diagnosed with IDC (negative brac1/2.) I also was just wondering if anyone else had ever experienced any symptoms of lactating? I know that milky discharge is not usually a problem, unless its bloody....but with the lump in addition? Thank you so much for your help...Annie8 hours ago Log in to post a reply
